1.text: I am the man who has seen affliction under the rod of God’s wrath.

2.text: He has driven me away and made me walk in darkness instead of light.

3.text: Indeed, He keeps turning His hand against me all day long.

4.text: He has worn away my flesh and skin; He has shattered my bones.

5.text: He has besieged me and surrounded me with bitterness and hardship.

6.text: He has made me dwell in darkness like those dead for ages.

7.text: He has walled me in so I cannot escape; He has weighed me down with chains.

8.text: Even when I cry out and plead for help, He shuts out my prayer.

9.text: He has barred my ways with cut stones; He has made my paths crooked.

10.text: He is a bear lying in wait, a lion hiding in ambush.

11.text: He forced me off my path and tore me to pieces; He left me without help.

12.text: He bent His bow and set me as the target for His arrow.

13.text: He pierced my kidneys with His arrows.

14.text: I am a laughingstock to all my people; they mock me in song all day long.

15.text: He has filled me with bitterness; He has intoxicated me with wormwood.

16.text: He has ground my teeth with gravel and trampled me in the dust.

17.text: My soul has been deprived of peace; I have forgotten what prosperity is.

18.text: So I say, “My strength has perished, along with my hope from the LORD.”

19.text: Remember my affliction and wandering, the wormwood and the gall.

20.text: Surely my soul remembers and is humbled within me.

21.text: Yet I call this to mind, and therefore I have hope:

22.text: Because of the loving devotion of the LORD we are not consumed, for His mercies never fail.

23.text: They are new every morning; great is Your faithfulness!

24.text: “The LORD is my portion,” says my soul, “therefore I will hope in Him.”

25.text: The LORD is good to those who wait for Him, to the soul who seeks Him.

26.text: It is good to wait quietly for the salvation of the LORD.

27.text: It is good for a man to bear the yoke while he is still young.

28.text: Let him sit alone in silence, for the LORD has laid it upon him.

29.text: Let him bury his face in the dust—perhaps there is still hope.

30.text: Let him offer his cheek to the one who would strike him; let him be filled with reproach.

31.text: For the Lord will not cast us off forever.

32.text: Even if He causes grief, He will show compassion according to His abundant loving devotion.

33.text: For He does not willingly afflict or grieve the sons of men.

34.text: To crush underfoot all the prisoners of the land,

35.text: to deny a man justice before the Most High,

36.text: to subvert a man in his lawsuit—of these the Lord does not approve.

37.text: Who has spoken and it came to pass, unless the Lord has ordained it?

38.text: Do not both adversity and good come from the mouth of the Most High?

39.text: Why should any mortal man complain, in view of his sins?

40.text: Let us examine and test our ways, and turn back to the LORD.

41.text: Let us lift up our hearts and hands to God in heaven:

42.text: “We have sinned and rebelled; You have not forgiven.”

43.text: You have covered Yourself in anger and pursued us; You have killed without pity.

44.text: You have covered Yourself with a cloud that no prayer can pass through.

45.text: You have made us scum and refuse among the nations.

46.text: All our enemies open their mouths against us.

47.text: Panic and pitfall have come upon us—devastation and destruction.

48.text: Streams of tears flow from my eyes over the destruction of the daughter of my people.

49.text: My eyes overflow unceasingly, without relief,

50.text: until the LORD looks down from heaven and sees.

51.text: My eyes bring grief to my soul because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: Without cause my enemies hunted me like a bird.

53.text: They dropped me alive into a pit and cast stones upon me.

54.text: The waters flowed over my head, and I thought I was going to die.

55.text: I called on Your name, O LORD, out of the depths of the Pit.

56.text: You heard my plea: “Do not ignore my cry for relief.”

57.text: You drew near when I called on You; You said, “Do not be afraid.”

58.text: You defend my cause, O Lord; You redeem my life.

59.text: You have seen, O LORD, the wrong done to me; vindicate my cause!

60.text: You have seen all their malice, all their plots against me.

61.text: O LORD, You have heard their insults, all their plots against me—

62.text: the slander and murmuring of my assailants against me all day long.

63.text: When they sit and when they rise, see how they mock me in song.

64.text: You will pay them back what they deserve, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.

65.text: Put a veil of anguish over their hearts; may Your curse be upon them!

66.text: You will pursue them in anger and exterminate them from under Your heavens, O LORD.
